class pyarcade.games.card.Rank[source]¶

Bases: pyarcade.games.ordered_enum.OrderedEnum

OrderedEnum to represent all playing card ranks. The value of aces is one. Jokers are not included.

ACE = 1¶
EIGHT = 8¶
FIVE = 5¶
FOUR = 4¶
JACK = 11¶
KING = 13¶
NINE = 9¶
QUEEN = 12¶
SEVEN = 7¶
SIX = 6¶
TEN = 10¶
THREE = 3¶
TWO = 2¶

A class representing a Mastermind game session

Parameters

  • max_range (int) – The range that a single digit can vary

evaluate(user_guess: List[int]) → str[source]¶
Parameters

user_guess –

Returns

1 if digit is in the hidden sequence at the location it was submitted 0 if digit is somewhere in the hidden sequence, but not in the location it was submitted -1 if the digit is nowhere in the hidden sequence

pyarcade.games.minesweeper module¶

class pyarcade.games.minesweeper.Minesweeper(width: Optional[int] = 9, height: Optional[int] = 9, mines: Optional[int] = 10)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class representing a Minesweeper game

Parameters

  • width (int) – width of the minesweeper grid

  • height (int) – height of minesweeper grid

  • mines (int) – number of mines to be placed in the grid

bfs(grid: [[<class 'str'>]], row_idx: int, col_idx: int, reveal_board: bool)[source]¶

Perform bfs to uncover of the surrounding cells that do not contain mines :param grid: the grid to perform bfs on :param row_idx: starting row index :param col_idx: starting column index :param reveal_board: option to either reveal the entire board including the mines (True) or not (False)

check_adjacent_mines(row: int, col: int) → str[source]¶
check_if_mine(r: int, c: int) → int[source]¶
clear_game_history() → str[source]¶
count_threebv()[source]¶

Calculates the threebv of the hidden grid. (threebv is the minimum number of clicks to uncover all of the mines.)

flood_fill(row_idx: int, col_idx: int, sol: [typing.List[int]], proc: [typing.List[int]])[source]¶

Processes the minesweeper grid by marking all of the cells reachable from the indices provided that are not mines :param row_idx: starting row of processed cell :param col_idx: starting col of processed cell :param sol: minesweeper grid solution (all hidden cells uncovered) :param proc: processed grid with all reachable cells from starting indices marked with *

Creates a minesweeper grid based on the mine locations that are provided :param mine_locations: indices of mines to be placed in grid

set_score()[source]¶

Score is calculated by dividing threebv by the amount of time for the player takes to find all of the mines
